info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 08 at 9:24PM EDT until June 08 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN FAYETTE...EASTERN MONONGALIA AND NORTHEASTERN PRESTON COUNTIES... At 924 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southwest of Friendsville, or 11 miles north of Terra Alta, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Kingwood, Albright, Markleysburg, Brandonville, Bruceton Mills, Valley Point, Laurel Run, Hazelton, Cranesville, and Clifton Mills. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for southwestern Pennsylvania...and northern and northeastern West Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
